RankDef.description: A common citizen of one of Skyrim's holds, possessing basic rights and freedoms under Nordic law.
A free Nord who owns property and has earned respect in their community through skill or service.
A household warrior sworn to serve a Thane or Jarl, providing personal protection and military service.
A personal bodyguard and sworn sword to a Thane, bound by oath to protect their liege with their life.
A lesser noble who has earned the trust of a Jarl through heroic deeds, granted lands and the right to bear arms.
The ruler of one of Skyrim's nine holds, wielding absolute authority over their domain and sworn to the High King.
The supreme ruler of all Skyrim, chosen from among the Jarls through the ancient Nordic tradition of the Moot.
A city or hold guard responsible for maintaining order and enforcing the Jarl's law.
The leader of a hold's guards, answering directly to the Jarl and responsible for maintaining security.
A soldier in Ulfric Stormcloak's rebellion, fighting for Skyrim's independence from the Empire.
A seasoned leader in the Stormcloak rebellion, commanding troops in the fight for Nordic independence.
The highest rank in Ulfric's Stormcloak army, reserved for the most trusted and capable warriors of the rebellion.
A religious leader who tends to one of Skyrim's temples, whether dedicated to the Nine Divines or traditional Nordic gods.
A wandering bard and storyteller who preserves Nordic culture and history through song, poem, and tale.
A master of the Thu'um who has withdrawn from worldly concerns to meditate on the Voice atop the Throat of the World.
One blessed with the soul of a dragon and the natural ability to learn and use the Thu'um, a figure of legend.
